intro: Tilia sitnensis, commonly known as the Sitnian linden, is a deciduous tree native to the Balkan region. It belongs to the Tiliaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and fragrant white flowers. The tree typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and is often found in forested areas. Its bark is smooth and grayish-brown, while its wood is valued for its fine texture and workability. The plant plays an important role in local ecosystems and has historical uses in traditional medicine.
